column4: I'm having problems with GDM. When I start my Ubuntu machine up, I get taken over to terminal 7 and a weird white box about 100 pixel height by 768 width shows up
Anyone have this problem? If so, how do I fix it?
Also, unrelated, but why would lsusb not show devices that are connected to a computer?
The devices in question work on another Linux box.
I've run modprobe uhci-hcd and modprobe ehci-hcd
Anyone?
lsusb should show the usb device connected.
Yes it should, but it doesn't.
mine show both the controllers and usb mouse/keyboard + camera
And these devices show up with lsusb on another Linux box (that doesn't run ubuntu).
you might want to try a different kernel or load the correct drivers for the device.
modprobe uhci-hcd && modprobe ehci-hcd
What more? That alone makes it work with udev on another Linux ox.
don't know. what type of device is it?
if it is a usbstorage device try to modprobe usbcore and usb-storage as well.
Well, all the kernel modules are being loaded by Ubuntu apparently.
And on other distributions it just works with those two modules.
you never answerd my question. what type of device is it? which kernel are you running (uname -a)
I didn't say it was one device. I was saying none of the USB devices were working.
It's 2.6.20. Feisty.
feisty is beta. go to #ubuntu+1
sounds like a kernel driver problem but I'm not sure. feisty support is in #ubuntu+1
